intro: Gouania remyi, commonly known as the Mexican gooseberry, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America, characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Gouania remyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
